intro: Cysticapnos vesicaria subsp. vesicaria, commonly known as the bladderleaf gentian, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate and have a distinctive bladder-like structure on the underside, giving it its common name. It is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
